unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Carrot Chips and $p$-Values
question_text: Jessica Rabbit loves carrot chips and buys one ounce bags to pack with her lunch. According to the label, there are an average of $25\text{ chips per ounce}$ . Jessica suspects that the true average is lower and decides to investigate. She selects $12\text{ bags of chips}$ (which she is willing to consider a random sample) and finds the average number of chips per bag is $23.4$ with a standard deviation of $4.6$ . Assuming all conditions are satisfied, what is the $p$ -value for the appropriate statistical test?
